alert.note: Alert for Butler (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 5:21PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL BUTLER COUNTY THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 521 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Hamilton, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, and frequent cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Locations impacted include... Hamilton, Middletown, Fairfield, Monroe, Trenton, South Middletown, Seven Mile, Williamsdale, New Miami, Jacksonburg and Maustown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
